header.title: filelib

erlref.modulesummary: File utilities, such as wildcard matching of filenames

description.p: This module contains utilities on a higher level than the file module.

section.title: DATA TYPES
section.code: filename() = string() | atom() | DeepList dirname() = filename() DeepList = [char() | atom() | DeepList]

func.name: ensure_dir(Name) -> ok | {error, Reason}
func.fsummary: Ensure that all parent directories for a file or directory exist.

desc.p: The ensure_dir/1 function ensures that all parent directories for the given file or directory name Name exist, trying to create them if necessary.
Returns ok if all parent directories already exist or could be created, or {error, Reason} if some parent directory does not exist and could not be created for some reason.

func.name: file_size(Filename) -> integer()
func.fsummary: Return the size in bytes of the file.

desc.p: The file_size function returns the size of the given file.

func.name: fold_files(Dir, RegExp, Recursive, Fun, AccIn) -> AccOut
func.fsummary: Fold over all files matching a regular expression.

desc.p: The fold_files/5 function folds the function Fun over all (regular) files F in the directory Dir that match the regular expression RegExp. If Recursive is true all sub-directories to Dir are processed. The match is tried on just the filename without the directory part.

func.name: is_dir(Name) -> true | false
func.fsummary: Test whether Name refer to a directory or not

desc.p: The is_dir/1 function returns true if Name refers to a directory, and false otherwise.

func.name: is_file(Name) -> true | false
func.fsummary: Test whether Name refer to a file or directory.

desc.p: The is_file/1 function returns true if Name refers to a file or a directory, and false otherwise.

func.name: is_regular(Name) -> true | false
func.fsummary: Test whether Name refer to a (regular) file.

desc.p: The is_regular/1 function returns true if Name refers to a file (regular file), and false otherwise.

func.name: last_modified(Name) -> {{Year,Month,Day},{Hour,Min,Sec}} | 0
func.fsummary: Return the local date and time when a file was last modified.

desc.p: The last_modified/1 function returns the date and time the given file or directory was last modified, or 0 if the file does not exist.
The wildcard/1 function returns a list of all files that match Unix-style wildcard-string Wildcard.
The wildcard string looks like an ordinary filename, except that certain "wildcard characters" are interpreted in a special way. The following characters are special:

item.p: Matches any number of characters up to the end of the filename, the next dot, or the next slash.
Alternation. Matches one of the alternatives.

desc.p: Other characters represent themselves. Only filenames that have exactly the same character in the same position will match. (Matching is case-sensitive; i.e. "a" will not match "A").
Note that multiple "*" characters are allowed (as in Unix wildcards, but opposed to Windows/DOS wildcards).

func.name: wildcard(Wildcard, Cwd) -> list()
func.fsummary: Match filenames using Unix-style wildcards starting at a specified directory.

desc.p: The wildcard/2 function works like wildcard/1, except that instead of the actual working directory, Cwd will be used.
